title: Change in KE and speed of Xe atoms with higher T

content.question: A <math alttext="1.0 mole " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="H e, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>He</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is mixed with a <math alttext="1.0 mole " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="X e, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Xe</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="50 degrees Celsius " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly predicts the changes in average kinetic energy and the average speed of the <math alttext="X e, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Xe</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms that will occur as the mixture approaches thermal equilibrium?

choices.label:
Average Kinetic Energy of <math alttext="X e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Xe</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Atoms
 Average Speed of <math alttext="X e" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Xe</mtext></mrow></math> Atoms

Will increase
 Will increase

 Will decrease
